mantraAdmin.name: mantraAdmin
mantraAdmin.description: The MIB module for entities implementing the xxxx protocol.

moduleSummary.name: moduleSummary
moduleSummary.description: A short summary of the status of the mantra software modules. This is provided as a convenience variable to the administrator, so he can see everything at a glance without polling each component separately. Processes can be in one of the four states: 0 - not started, 1 - in the process of starting up, 2 - up, but inactive (only one process in a fail-over group is active at a time) 3 - up, and active 4 - died (on its own) 5 - stopped, i.e. by some command

mantraUpTime.name: mantraUpTime
mantraUpTime.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the mantra software was last re-initialized.

mantraRetryCount.name: mantraRetryCount
mantraRetryCount.description: The number of retry attempts to make when starting a software component managed by this mib.

mantraRetryInterval.name: mantraRetryInterval
mantraRetryInterval.description: The time in seconds between the above retry attempts.

mantraReboot.name: mantraReboot
mantraReboot.description: Each time the user executes a set on this entry with a value equal to 1, all components controlled by this module in the softswitch are rebooted.

mantraTurnoff.name: mantraTurnoff
mantraTurnoff.description: Each time the user executes a set on this entry with a value equal to 1, all components controlled by this module in the softswitch are turned off.

startProcess.name: startProcess
startProcess.description: The user can set this entry to the name of the module that needs to be started, and it causes that process to be restarted. If the process is already running, no action takes place. The process name being set must be in the same format switch:group:pid, as returned in moduleSummary

stopProcess.name: stopProcess
stopProcess.description: The user can set this entry to the name of the module that needs to be stopped, and it causes that process to be stopped. If the process is already stopped, no action takes place. The process name being set must be in the same format switch:group:pid, as returned in moduleSummary

currentProcess.name: currentProcess
currentProcess.description: The user can set this entry to the name of the process he wants to interact with, and all future gets on processState variable return the health information for that process

processState.name: processState
processState.description: A get on this variable returns the health of the process named in currentProcess variable.
